body_content.explanation: (of a person, family, etc.) generally able to obtain enough food:
examples: The majority of people lived in households that were food secure.
They were considered to be food secure because they had regular access to enough food.

body_content.explanation: (of a country, region) able to produce or obtain enough food to feed its population:
examples: The government has a number of policies aimed at making the country food secure.
Regular drought or floods prompt refugees to flee to more fertile, food-secure areas.
